Constructed to preserve the building techniques of the past, the building exemplifies hand-hewn woodworking skills in Thailand. Built based on the religious philosophy of impermanence, the complex features four wings dedicated to Thai, Khmer, Chinese and Indian religious iconography respectively. Check out the intricate wooden carvings as you walk around the building.

Teddy Bear Museum, also known as Teddy Island, is a truly unique place in Pattaya. Located in a teddy-bear themed building, it houses a staggering 1,000 stuffed animals and lets you journey through time and discover interesting stories behind one of the world's most popular toys. This fun experience is meant to be shared with family and friends and is a great place for children. This is not your typical museum so forget strict rules and limitations - at the Teddy Bear Museum you can touch and interact with every exhibit. Make sure you have your camera ready - Pattaya's teddy bear island is sight to remember.

Microlight or Ultralight flying is the up and coming sport in Thailand. Once a privileged experience only for a select few, now this unique sport is accessible to all. Cruise at speeds of up to 80mph, giving you time to appreciate the blue seas and spectacular views below, and the graceful movements of your ultralight aircraft, for 15 or 25 minutes of flight time. This experienced company, using instructors with thousands of hours experience in the air, and the safest ultralight aircrafts, aims to make sport aviation accessible for all, with one of Thailand's most affordable flight experiences.

Explore the African Savanna with zebras, rhinos and giraffes, see lions and tigers at the Cats Complex, walk through the colorful aviary, and ride through the one-acre deer park. strIntroduction: Watch Pattaya's newest cabaret show, in the unique Roman amphitheater venue, from an exclusive VIP seat viewpoint Enjoy the spectacular show from front and center seating Watch spectacular acts, impressive costumes and talented ladyboy performers Visit the spectacular Colosseum reconstruction with a glamorous interior too Enjoy the spectacular show from front and center seating Watch spectacular acts, impressive costumes and talented ladyboy performers Visit the spectacular Colosseum reconstruction with a glamorous interior too What We Love:   What We Love: The Colosseum show is the latest, largest and most extravagant contender on Pattaya's cabaret show scene, offering Thai and foreign audiences a vividly colorful extravaganza of traditional and contemporary cabaret entertainment. The impressive theatre, designed in the style of Rome's famous entertainment arena provides uninterrupted views of the state-of-the-art stage for every audience member. The 16-segment show, with acts inspired by cultures from across the world, features everything from traditional Thai dance to a Marilyn Monroe tribute. The audience begin the journey in Italy, then venture through Asia and India before returning back to the west. strIntroduction: INSTANTBook now and get your e-ticket instantly INSTANT  Book now and get your e-ticket instantly Join a one day immersive experience of Chiang Mai taking you to its oldest temples, busy local markets, a relaxing river cruise and more - complete with an authentic northern Thai lunch at a local farm Explore Chiang Mai's authentic culture, lifestyle and laid back atmosphere on the Mae Ping River Experience tour Visit one of Chiang Mai's oldest temple communities - Chai Monkol - and uncover the way of life of the local monks Indulge in a bowl of in Khao Soy, a traditional northern Thai noodle soup over lunch at a traditional farm Cruise the Mae Ping River in a long tail boat and discover the busy life along its river banks Explore Chiang Mai's authentic culture, lifestyle and laid back atmosphere on the Mae Ping River Experience tour Visit one of Chiang Mai's oldest temple communities - Chai Monkol - and uncover the way of life of the local monks Indulge in a bowl of in Khao Soy, a traditional northern Thai noodle soup over lunch at a traditional farm Cruise the Mae Ping River in a long tail boat and discover the busy life along its river banks What We Love:   What We Love: Go in for a truly authentic experience of Chiang Mai - a city in mountainous northern Thailand dating all the way back to the 1200s. Spend the day discovering Chiang Mai's traditionally relaxed pace of life as you shop at the local markets, cruise down the Mae Ping River and sample signature delicacies. Start off with the visit to the bustling Warorot Market, the most famous central market in Chiang Mai before heading to the relaxing and colorful Ton Lam Yai Flower Market. Then, the tour takes you to Wat Chai Monkol — one of the oldest monastery communities in Chiang Mai founded over 600 years ago. Stop for a break at a local farmer's house where you will get to enjoy local delicacies and learn about Thailand's famous vegetables and herbs. Return to Chiang Mai on a long tail boat taking you down the picturesque Mae Ping River.

Partake in a beautiful tradition filled with light, smiles and happiness with tickets for Yeepeng Lanna Lantern Festival in the Sansai District of Chiang Mai Participate in one of Chiang Mai's most beautiful traditions - Thailand's largest Yeepeng Lanna festival, a mesmerizing lantern festival Watch thousands of candle lit lanterns take to the sky and send your own lantern into the air Sample authentic Lanna food and explore the region's rich history and culture with cultural activities and performances taking place around the festival Don't miss the rare chance to witness incredible beauty - Yeepeng Lanna takes place only once a year Participate in one of Chiang Mai's most beautiful traditions - Thailand's largest Yeepeng Lanna festival, a mesmerizing lantern festival Watch thousands of candle lit lanterns take to the sky and send your own lantern into the air Sample authentic Lanna food and explore the region's rich history and culture with cultural activities and performances taking place around the festival Don't miss the rare chance to witness incredible beauty - Yeepeng Lanna takes place only once a year What We Love:   What We Love: Yeepeng (or Yi Peng) Lanna is the lantern festival, taking place every year in the Sansai District of Chiang Mai. Also coinciding with Loi Krathong festival, it's a beautiful evening where traditional paper lanterns with candles are released into the sky, painting the city with bright lights. Complete with cultural performances, parades and contests, the festival is a great way to feel the true friendly nature of Chiang Mai, discover local traditions, meet new people and more. Feel the inspiration of this magical ritual as you dive into the relaxing Lanna atmosphere. Make a wish as you send your lantern into flight and don't forget to take a photo of this dazzling unforgettable night.

Luckily, you'll be led by highly experienced instructors given you tips and guidance throughout. Having lunch in a cave is not something you do everyday, so this delicious Thai meal will feel extra special. Emerge back into the open air and head to peaceful Mae Kampong Village, where you will stay at the home of a friendly and hospitable villager, eat an authentic, home-cooked dinner and breakfast, and receive an invigorating one hour Thai massage. You will spend the next morning ziplining, giving you the sensation of flying through the jungle before a delicious lunch and a refreshing dip in the scenic waterfalls.

Ride an elephant, get to know some of Chiang Mai's local hill tribes, and take a dip by a waterfall in this day trek! Visit the hill village of the Akha tribe and explore the area for a taste of every day local life, learn about their culture from your guide, and delight in a delicious lunch meal. You'll then be treated to a tranquil bamboo raft ride along the river and a thrilling white water adventure. If you're looking for an easy day in the outdoors with some cultural immersion, we reckon this is a trek you'll thoroughly enjoy!

Enjoy a challenging cycling adventure on the hill of Doi Lom Bike around the scenic Chiang Mai countryside with the leading of your experienced guide, who is dedicated to this circuit Take in the scenic views of quiet rice paddies and lush mountainsides around Doi Lom hill Ride past the villages of Karen and Hmong tribes, and learn a thing or two about their culture and daily customs Enjoy the challenge of intense uphill riding, which is equally rewarding for the spectacular views you'll find up ahead Bike around the scenic Chiang Mai countryside with the leading of your experienced guide, who is dedicated to this circuit Bike around the scenic Chiang Mai countryside with the leading of your experienced guide, who is dedicated to this circuit Take in the scenic views of quiet rice paddies and lush mountainsides around Doi Lom hill Take in the scenic views of quiet rice paddies and lush mountainsides around Doi Lom hill Ride past the villages of Karen and Hmong tribes, and learn a thing or two about their culture and daily customs Ride past the villages of Karen and Hmong tribes, and learn a thing or two about their culture and daily customs Enjoy the challenge of intense uphill riding, which is equally rewarding for the spectacular views you'll find up ahead Enjoy the challenge of intense uphill riding, which is equally rewarding for the spectacular views you'll find up ahead What We Love:   What We Love: Take on a biking challenge along the rough dirt roads of the Chiang Mai countryside. This cycling adventure is for those who are up for a challenge, with steeper inclines and lush slopes that make for intense uphill riding – as well as equally scenic views! Ride past quiet rice paddies and scenic mountain views. Stop by the villages of Karen and Hmong tribes, and get to know a thing or two about their culture and daily customs. You'll have rest stops as well as the opportunity to roam the countryside, before pedaling onward to the top, and enjoying the rewards of incredible Chiang Mai panoramas. Away from the tourist hustle, this cycling challenge on Doi Lom hill is the perfect adventure for the outdoor lover!

Pedal your way up to a Buddhist sanctuary on a hill, then make your way down to Huay Tung Tao Lake Ride hard to the top of Doi Suthep mountain, where you'll be rewarded with incredible views Drop by the renowned Wat Prathat Temple, and marvel at the intricate displays as well as a replica of the Emerald Buddha Bike past the Royal Winter Palace and a Hmong Hill Tribe Village Cycle along a dirt road, against the backdrop of orchards, forest, and an abundance of Chiang Mai greenery Enjoy lunch on a floating bamboo hut at Huay Tung Tao Lake Ride hard to the top of Doi Suthep mountain, where you'll be rewarded with incredible views Ride hard to the top of Doi Suthep mountain, where you'll be rewarded with incredible views Drop by the renowned Wat Prathat Temple, and marvel at the intricate displays as well as a replica of the Emerald Buddha Drop by the renowned Wat Prathat Temple, and marvel at the intricate displays as well as a replica of the Emerald Buddha Bike past the Royal Winter Palace and a Hmong Hill Tribe Village Bike past the Royal Winter Palace and a Hmong Hill Tribe Village Cycle along a dirt road, against the backdrop of orchards, forest, and an abundance of Chiang Mai greenery Cycle along a dirt road, against the backdrop of orchards, forest, and an abundance of Chiang Mai greenery Enjoy lunch on a floating bamboo hut at Huay Tung Tao Lake Enjoy lunch on a floating bamboo hut at Huay Tung Tao Lake What We Love:   What We Love: Embark on a cycling challenge to the holy temple of Wat Phra That, located near the peak of Doi Suthep mountain. You'll begin from your hotel and cycle some 12km uphill, toward the famous Chiang Mai landmark, known for its intricate shrines, as well as a replica of the revered Emerald Buddha. Glimpse incredible mountaintop views from the tip of Doi Suthep, before making your way back and passing the Royal Winter Palace, as well as a Hmong hill tribe village. You'll be biking on a dirt road soon after, which winds through fruits orchards and forests, scenic sites and wonders. Watch out for light rays and any surface reflection of the sun – it is then you'll know you've come to the Huay Tung Tao Lake, a beautiful place to enjoy lunch on a floating bamboo hut, and refuel for the journey back.

Enjoy a leisurely biking trip, see the beautiful Bua Thong Waterfall, canoe on the Mae Ngat Dam, and enjoy a swim with the family Go on an easy biking trip and head toward Phrao, where you'll see the beautiful Bua Thong Waterfall amidst incredible limestone cliffs Enjoy a relaxing canoe trip at the Mae Ngat Dam, where you'll come to a floating hotel and enjoy a good swim Savor a scenic biking journey around the calm and quiet Chiang Mai countryside Go on an easy biking trip and head toward Phrao, where you'll see the beautiful Bua Thong Waterfall amidst incredible limestone cliffs Go on an easy biking trip and head toward Phrao, where you'll see the beautiful Bua Thong Waterfall amidst incredible limestone cliffs Enjoy a relaxing canoe trip at the Mae Ngat Dam, where you'll come to a floating hotel and enjoy a good swim Enjoy a relaxing canoe trip at the Mae Ngat Dam, where you'll come to a floating hotel and enjoy a good swim Savor a scenic biking journey around the calm and quiet Chiang Mai countryside Savor a scenic biking journey around the calm and quiet Chiang Mai countryside What We Love:   What We Love: Roam the Chiang Mai countryside with an easy biking trip and leisurely canoe ride. Perfect for families and kids, this adventure takes you toward Phrao, northwest of the district, where you'll see the beautiful Bua Thong waterfall, and then visit the Mae Ngat Dam for a laid-back canoe trip. Enjoy biking along soft inclines and easy slopes, and pack your swimsuits as the end of the trip involves a swim at a nearby floating hotel. If you're looking for an easy way to enjoy the scenic Chiang Mai landscape, you're sure to enjoy this mini biking adventure.

Head north of Chiang Mai to Chiang Dao and enjoy an elephant ride, a trip on a bamboo raft, an incredible cave complex and more Visit the Chiang Dao Elephant Camp and enjoy a 1.5hrs elephant ride to Lisu Hill Tribe Village Enjoy a tranquil 1 hour river journey on a bamboo raft See the Chiang Dao Caves and its incredible temple. Marvel at the countless Buddha images, and once inside, have a guide to light the pathway for you Take a dip in the Bua Tong Waterfalls for a refreshing swim Visit the Chiang Dao Elephant Camp and enjoy a 1.5hrs elephant ride to Lisu Hill Tribe Village Visit the Chiang Dao Elephant Camp and enjoy a 1.5hrs elephant ride to Lisu Hill Tribe Village Enjoy a tranquil 1 hour river journey on a bamboo raft Enjoy a tranquil 1 hour river journey on a bamboo raft See the Chiang Dao Caves and its incredible temple. The district is known for its Elephant Camp, reportedly one of the best in the city. Spend some time getting acquainted with these lovely, massive creatures' morning routines, before getting on their backs and enjoying an hour and half's ride to Lisu Hill Tribe village. The path takes you along a quiet river embraced by verdant forests, before you settle into a delicious, local lunch, and then embark on a quiet bamboo raft ride. You'll then see the Chiang Dao Caves - a complex of 100 caves, five of which are open to the public. Glimpse the incredible Buddha images in the interiors. You may even opt for the company of a guide and their gas lantern to light the path and your photographs. The journey wraps up with a refreshing dip in the Bua Tong Waterfalls, and a cool swim by the pool's limestone rocks.

Explore fascinating landmarks in this journey, featuring the White Temple, the Black House, and the city of Chiang Rai on a day tour from Chiang Mai See the beautifully eerie and intricate Wat Rong Khun, also known as the White Temple, designed by National Artist Chalermchai Kositpipat Stop by the Black House, a museum and the home of National Artist Dr. Thawan Duchanee, and see its incredible interiors and bone displays Enjoy a delicious local lunch to fuel your journey See the beautifully eerie and intricate Wat Rong Khun, also known as the White Temple, designed by National Artist Chalermchai Kositpipat See the beautifully eerie and intricate Wat Rong Khun, also known as the White Temple, designed by National Artist Chalermchai Kositpipat Stop by the Black House, a museum and the home of National Artist Dr. Thawan Duchanee, and see its incredible interiors and bone displays Stop by the Black House, a museum and the home of National Artist Dr. Thawan Duchanee, and see its incredible interiors and bone displays Enjoy a delicious local lunch to fuel your journey Enjoy a delicious local lunch to fuel your journey What We Love:   What We Love: Be captivated by the incredible sights of Chiang Rai in this day exploration. Visit Wat Rong Khun, the spectacular White Temple known for its hauntingly beautiful blend of cultural and contemporary details. Designed by Thai National Artist Chalermchai Kositpipat, the temple features an entrance with outstretched hands, Predator jutting from the ground, as well as a number of other pop culture references within the dazzling white structure. Then head off to the Black House, a museum and also the home of the National Artist Dr. Thawan Duchanee. There you'll find a complex of dark and eerily designed buildings, filled with bones, skulls, fur and feathers, displayed and arranged as though an exhibit, but also as homely ornamentation. It's a fascinating immersion in the Thai north, one that captivates with its beauty, as well as its mystery.

See Thailand's highest mountains and visit an ethnic hill tribe in the country's premier national park Spend a day at Doi Inthanon National Park and immerse yourself in northern Thailand's rich, natural bounty See the Wachiritharn and Siritharn Waterfalls, glimpse the agricultural work at the Royal Project Research Station, and the get incredible panoramic views of the park from the King and Queen's chedis (Buddhist stupas) Make it to the perch of Thailand's highest peak, and take in the vast expanse of forest and greenery Roam amidst more flora along the Angkha Nature Walk Drop by Karen and Hmong Villages, and get to know the locals Spend a day at Doi Inthanon National Park and immerse yourself in northern Thailand's rich, natural bounty Spend a day at Doi Inthanon National Park and immerse yourself in northern Thailand's rich, natural bounty See the Wachiritharn and Siritharn Waterfalls, glimpse the agricultural work at the Royal Project Research Station, and the get incredible panoramic views of the park from the King and Queen's chedis (Buddhist stupas) See the Wachiritharn and Siritharn Waterfalls, glimpse the agricultural work at the Royal Project Research Station, and the get incredible panoramic views of the park from the King and Queen's chedis (Buddhist stupas) Make it to the perch of Thailand's highest peak, and take in the vast expanse of forest and greenery Make it to the perch of Thailand's highest peak, and take in the vast expanse of forest and greenery Roam amidst more flora along the Angkha Nature Walk Roam amidst more flora along the Angkha Nature Walk Drop by Karen and Hmong Villages, and get to know the locals Drop by Karen and Hmong Villages, and get to know the locals What We Love:   What We Love: Roam Northern Thailand's vast forest bounty with a day at the Doi Inthanon National Park. Walk up to the thunderous Wachiritharn and Siritharn Waterfalls, and take a look at the agricultural work of the Royal Project Research Station. Continue on amidst forest greenery until you get to the King and Queen's chedis, where you'll find some of the best views of the park, and then proceed to the top of Doi Inthanon, the highest mountain in Thailand, where even more spectacular panoramas await. A nature walk follows along the Angkha Trail, before you arrive at a Karen and Hmong Ethnic Village, then work your way back down to end your full day spent in nature.

Roam the hills of Chiang Mai and get to know the diverse local communities with a private tour guide Visit 5 different hill tribe villages in Chiang Mai and get to know their culture and customs. You'll kick off with stops at an orchid and butterfly farm, before heading off to the different community villages. Meet the Akha, who are known for their spirituality; the Meo, whom you'll notice for their grounded homes, as opposed to being propped on stilts; the Lisu, outgoing people often settled near water; the Palong, a smaller group known for growing tea; and the Karens, masterful weavers, and also the most populous in Thailand. Befriend the locals and learn a thing or two about their customs and culture, before capping off the day with a trip to the Chiang Dao Cave and Temple, an enchanting limestone cave complex.

Spend a fully packed day around Chiang Rai's historical landmarks, from the White Temple to the Mekong River and the Golden Triangle Make your way to the meeting point of Thailand, Laos and Myanmar – also known as The Golden Triangle Enjoy a warm cup of coffee at the Maekhajan Hot Springs See the spectacularly intricate Wat Rong Khun, also known as the White Temple Opt for a boat ride along the Mekong River to the Laotian island of Don Sao Pick up some mementos at the border market between Thailand and Myanmar Stop by the villages of the Akh and Yao Hill Tribes Make your way to the meeting point of Thailand, Laos and Myanmar – also known as The Golden Triangle Make your way to the meeting point of Thailand, Laos and Myanmar – also known as The Golden Triangle Enjoy a warm cup of coffee at the Maekhajan Hot Springs Enjoy a warm cup of coffee at the Maekhajan Hot Springs See the spectacularly intricate Wat Rong Khun, also known as the White Temple See the spectacularly intricate Wat Rong Khun, also known as the White Temple Opt for a boat ride along the Mekong River to the Laotian island of Don Sao Opt for a boat ride along the Mekong River to the Laotian island of Don Sao Pick up some mementos at the border market between Thailand and Myanmar Pick up some mementos at the border market between Thailand and Myanmar Stop by the villages of the Akh and Yao Hill Tribes Stop by the villages of the Akh and Yao Hill Tribes What We Love:   What We Love: Hop on a whirlwind journey around landmark Chiang Mai and even make a stop at the Golden Triangle, known as the meeting point of Thailand, Laos and Myanmar. This extensive tour of the northern Thai province begins with a stop at the Mae Khajan Hot Springs and the nearby Wat Rong Khun. Also known as the White Temple, Wat Rong Khun is known best for its incredible white structure, intricate in detail and eerie in thematic references. You'll then be whisked away to the cross point of Thailand, Laos and Myanmar. The opportunity to sail down the Mekong River awaits, toward the Laotian island of Don Sao. From there, head to Mae Sai, the border down near Myanmar where you'll get to enjoy a mini market shopping spree. Then head back to the city center of Chiang Mai, but not before making a stop at the villages of Akha and Yao Hill Tribes, and getting to know a thing or two about their day-to-day lives and cultural practices.

You will learn all about cave exploration, view remarkable features of caves that few get to see, and do all this at the awe-inspiring Crazy Horse Buttress, one of the world's most sought-after climbing spots. Love: Experience the adventures of Chiang Mai's jungle on this special two-day tour. Start at Crazy Horse Buttress, famed for its jaw-dropping limestone cliffs, perfect for rock-climbing and abseiling. After learning the basics from Thailand's most experienced and talented instructors, you will then practice scaling up the rocks, or rappelling down to deep, mysterious caves. Then head over to Mae Kampong Village; located within the jungles, you won't find much cell phone reception, but you will find peace, tranquility, and warm local hospitality. After a relaxing Thai massage, you will have the chance to sample an authentic home-cooked meal prepared by the villagers, before retiring for the night at one of the village houses. strIntroduction: INSTANTBook now and get your e-ticket instantly INSTANT  Book now and get your e-ticket instantly Embark on a small group walking tour through the old Sino-Portuguese town giving you a full insight into the Phuket of hundreds of years ago Start the day visiting a local fresh market Visit Chinpracha House and Thai Hua museum Stroll through the old town visiting the old post office and first hotel in Phuket Hotel pick up and lunch are included Start the day visiting a local fresh market Start the day visiting a local fresh market Visit Chinpracha House and Thai Hua museum Visit Chinpracha House and Thai Hua museum Stroll through the old town visiting the old post office and first hotel in Phuket Stroll through the old town visiting the old post office and first hotel in Phuket Hotel pick up and lunch are included Hotel pick up and lunch are included What We Love:   What We Love: Thought Phuket was just a resort town? In fact Phuket has been home to a major trading port and tin mining industry dating back to the 19th century that brought thousands of Chinese migrants to Phuket's shores . With these flourishing industries came infrastructure that still stands today. Now a quaint town this tour brings the past back to life with all the stories and facts about what used to be. Start the day with a visit to the fresh market before heading to Chinpracha House and Thai Hua museum. Stroll through the old town famous for it's Sino-Portuguese architecture, those feeling peckish can try out some Hokkien style noodles and Malay tea which still remain popular from the days of the Chinese migrants.

Beyond the ATV riding, there's also the option for a 30-minute elephant trek, monkey show and chance to meet the young elephants too!

Experienced guides are with you throughout, to guarantee your safety and ensure that this will be one of your holiday highlights!

With lifeguards at every attraction, you can relax knowing the whole family's safe. Enjoy the in-park facilities, cashless payment system and you can even rent a private cabana. There's something for the whole family to enjoy.

You'll be downright wowed by the outstanding set designs, extravagant costumes and glamorous performers. The show features modern and traditional acts from across the globe, set within an intimate theatre with hi-tech sound and lighting equipment, and accompanied by upbeat songs and Thailand's famed *kathoey* (‘ladyboy') dancers.

Muay Thai boxing, an ancient martial art, is unlike traditional Western Boxing in many ways. You'll be amazed at the pace of the sport with men and women fighters using not just their fists, but also elbows, knees and feet to trick and beat their opponent. If you are already a fan of Muay Thai, looking for some evening entertainment or just want to get the complete experience when in Thailand – a real Muay Thai match should certainly be high on your itinerary.

The result is a stunning 140-acre themed complex packed with a multitude of activities and entertainments: a carnival village with games, handicrafts and shopping; a 4,000 seat themed restaurant offering a grand buffet of Thai and international cuisines; a breathtaking Las Vegas-style theatrical show, displaying Thailand's myths, mysteries, grace and beauty, not to mention the troupe of elephants, fire-eaters, graceful dancers and even a tiger! This wondrous extravaganza is certain to delight the whole family.

The three-act show takes you on a Thai journey combining an impressive range of dance, martial arts and acrobatics. One of the largest productions in the world, it features over 100 performers (in over 500 costumes!) and outstanding set design. It's worth coming early for the pre-show to see various cultural Thai treasures: a traditional village (complete with floating market), a fountain and light show, amazing dance performances, Thai boxing and even elephant feeding and rides! Opt to include dinner to indulge in a sumptuous range of Thai and International dishes including vegetarian and halal food – simply delicious!

Once in the Aonang Beach area, you'll transfer to a smaller speedboat to begin the island exploration. Hop between the tropical shores of Chicken Island, Tup Island, Poda Island and Phra Nang Cave (home to some interestingly shaped shrine sculptures…) The waters here are beautifully clear and the marine life is certain to amaze. Swimming, snorkeling, sunbathing, sea sports and exploring are the main callings of the day with a delicious lunch at Railay beach included too.

strIntroduction: INSTANTBook now and get your e-ticket instantly INSTANT  Book now and get your e-ticket instantly Venture south just half an hour by speedboat and discover a world of amazing coral, beautiful beaches and calm seas Spend a day enjoying the beauty of Raya Island and world-class snorkeling Weak currents and amazing snorkeling close to shore makes this a perfect spot for snorkeling beginners and younger children Tuck in to a delicious local lunch at Raya Seafood Restaurant Enjoy hotel transfers included Spend a day enjoying the beauty of Raya Island and world-class snorkeling Spend a day enjoying the beauty of Raya Island and world-class snorkeling Weak currents and amazing snorkeling close to shore makes this a perfect spot for snorkeling beginners and younger children Weak currents and amazing snorkeling close to shore makes this a perfect spot for snorkeling beginners and younger children Tuck in to a delicious local lunch at Raya Seafood Restaurant Tuck in to a delicious local lunch at Raya Seafood Restaurant Enjoy hotel transfers included Enjoy hotel transfers included What We Love:   What We Love: The tropical shores of Raya Island are just far enough off Phuket's southern coast that the tourist troops haven't quite discovered it yet, but close enough to make it a worthy day trip destination. A 30-minute speedboat ride brings you to sun kissed beaches and turquoise waters favored amongst divers for coral reefs just teeming with aquatic life. First stop is the island's most beautiful beach, Patok, where you can relax and swim to your heart's content. Excellent snorkeling awaits at Kon Kae Bay where giant star fish, puffer fish and rainbow trout can all be spotted. Enjoy a sumptuous lunch at Raya Seafood Restaurant before the warm waters and gleaming sands beckon you for a few more hours of swimming and basking in the sun.

With a license, descend to depths of up to 30 meters amongst colourful coral on a slope dive or for beginners, take your first dip into the world of scuba in Raya's beautifully clear waters Make 2 dives at one of Thailand's premier sites Receive friendly and informative instruction from a professional diver Complete beginners will receive instruction and guidance allowing them to scuba dive in shallower waters Feel safe in this operator's years of experience, wealth of positive reviews and top quality equipment Enjoy a delicious lunch between your dives Transfers from your hotel and back are included Make 2 dives at one of Thailand's premier sites Make 2 dives at one of Thailand's premier sites Receive friendly and informative instruction from a professional diver Receive friendly and informative instruction from a professional diver Complete beginners will receive instruction and guidance allowing them to scuba dive in shallower waters Complete beginners will receive instruction and guidance allowing them to scuba dive in shallower waters Feel safe in this operator's years of experience, wealth of positive reviews and top quality equipment Feel safe in this operator's years of experience, wealth of positive reviews and top quality equipment Enjoy a delicious lunch between your dives Enjoy a delicious lunch between your dives Transfers from your hotel and back are included Transfers from your hotel and back are included What We Love:   What We Love: As one of the furthest islands off Phuket's southern coast, you'll find Raya Yai to be delightfully uncrowded and unspoilt. Boasting mile upon mile of white sandy beaches and world class diving in beautifully clear waters, just a one hour boat ride from Phuket. A typical dive here is a gentle drift along a sloping rock face, sprinkled with a variety of coral forests. Large schools of false barracuda, octopi and cuttlefish can often be spotted, as well as other more common tropical species and Manta Rays. Dives at Raya Yai are calm and easy with depths ranging from 2 meters through to 30+ meters making it perfect for those wanting a relaxing dive and first timers too. The team of highly experienced staff at South Siam have an excellent reputation for safety and instruction. This will be a sure contender for best dive experience, whether you're a proficient diver or complete novice.

Small enough to circumnavigate by foot, these islands are pleasantly undeveloped, providing a true tranquil escape from the bustle of Phuket. Long white sands and exceptional year-round snorkeling and swimming make it a perfect destination for daytrippers. You'll hop between the two islands, finding your perfect spot to snorkel or relax before heading to shore for a delicious BBQ buffet lunch at a beachside restaurant. The emerald waters are home to a wealth of colorful aquatic life, where sightings of vibrant coral, rainbow trout, puffer fish and giant star fish are all on the agenda.

Relax in boating bliss as you sail to a tropical island paradise, enjoying water activities from a luxury yacht Experience the exclusive comfort of yachting to Raya or Maiton Islands Enjoy activities in the uncrowded, coral-filled waters surrounding the boat such as swimming, snorkeling and fishing Tuck in to a sumptuous BBQ lunch onboard Enjoy the convenience of complimentary hotel transfers Experience the exclusive comfort of yachting to Raya or Maiton Islands Experience the exclusive comfort of yachting to Raya or Maiton Islands Enjoy activities in the uncrowded, coral-filled waters surrounding the boat such as swimming, snorkeling and fishing Enjoy activities in the uncrowded, coral-filled waters surrounding the boat such as swimming, snorkeling and fishing Tuck in to a sumptuous BBQ lunch onboard Tuck in to a sumptuous BBQ lunch onboard Enjoy the convenience of complimentary hotel transfers Enjoy the convenience of complimentary hotel transfers What We Love:   What We Love: Glide through tropical Thai waters aboard a luxury sailing yacht. Departing from Phuket, you can recline and sunbath on deck before arriving at Maiton or Raya Island (season dependent) a few kilometers south. Drawing fewer crowds, these islands are renowned for their spectacularly blue waters, romantic beaches and incredible aquatic life. Spend the day sightseeing, snorkeling, fishing and swimming from the back of the yacht before a BBQ buffet lunch is served on board. What more relaxing way to visit the islands!

With pristine, palm-fringed beaches and turquoise waters, it's no surprise this was the choice destination for the Dicaprio blockbuster. This full day island-hopping trip will first take you to the sparkling sands of Bamboo Island. A private crescent-shaped bay where you can relax on the beach or snorkel beautifully clear waters. Departing for Hin Klang, you'll be mesmerized by the colorful marine life and coral reef resting just feet below the surface, before heading to Phi Phi Don for a beachside restaurant lunch. A sightseeing cruise will take you past the islands' fascinating rock formations to where it's feeding time at Monkey Beach. The most fascinating part of the trip comes in the form of Phi Phi Lay. Here you'll find the Viking Cave, home to a thriving bird's nest soup industry and of course, Maya Bay, where you can explore the spectacular setting of ‘The Beach'.

Motor to remote Ko Dok Mai Island to enjoy a great variety of dives which more experienced divers will love: a wreck, a wall dive and a coral dive Make 3 dives at one of Thailand's premier sites, great for qualified divers Receive friendly and informative instruction from a professional diver Have a pre-dive briefing and quick refresher before you go in Feel safe in this operator's years of experience, wealth of positive reviews and top quality equipment Enjoy a delicious lunch between your dives Transfers from your hotel and back are included Make 3 dives at one of Thailand's premier sites, great for qualified divers Make 3 dives at one of Thailand's premier sites, great for qualified divers Receive friendly and informative instruction from a professional diver Receive friendly and informative instruction from a professional diver Have a pre-dive briefing and quick refresher before you go in Have a pre-dive briefing and quick refresher before you go in Feel safe in this operator's years of experience, wealth of positive reviews and top quality equipment Feel safe in this operator's years of experience, wealth of positive reviews and top quality equipment Enjoy a delicious lunch between your dives Enjoy a delicious lunch between your dives Transfers from your hotel and back are included Transfers from your hotel and back are included What We Love:   What We Love: Dive at three premier sites off the Phuket coast in one day. The King Cruiser is a car ferry wreck from 1997. She came to rest 32 meters down and now attracts huge schools of barracuda, travellies and snappers as well as scorpion fish and lionfish. The three pinnacles of Shark point are covered with hard and soft coral and known particularly for leopard sharks and nurse sharks. Ko Dok Mai (flower island) is a small lone island boasting excellent wall diving ranging from 20-30 meters as well as two caves. Rock oysters, giant clams, sea fans, sea horses, shrimp, nudibranch and schools of yellow tail barracuda can all be seen here. Dive with a team of highly experienced staff, all with an excellent reputation for safety and instruction - you're guaranteed to have a great day under the water!

With an excellent reputation in these parts, DaVinci will provide you and your guests with the most luxurious and relaxing way to explore these beautiful Thai waters Cruise the Andaman's turquoise seas with a relaxing catamaran charter Receive first-class service and hospitality from the experienced crew plus inclusive food and drinks Learn the basics of sailing or sit back as the expert skipper and crew take control Sunbath on deck, snorkel from the boat, or swim ashore for an idyllic beach stroll Cruise the Andaman's turquoise seas with a relaxing catamaran charter Cruise the Andaman's turquoise seas with a relaxing catamaran charter Receive first-class service and hospitality from the experienced crew plus inclusive food and drinks Receive first-class service and hospitality from the experienced crew plus inclusive food and drinks Learn the basics of sailing or sit back as the expert skipper and crew take control Learn the basics of sailing or sit back as the expert skipper and crew take control Sunbath on deck, snorkel from the boat, or swim ashore for an idyllic beach stroll Sunbath on deck, snorkel from the boat, or swim ashore for an idyllic beach stroll What We Love:   What We Love: Discover secluded snorkeling spots and hidden bays aboard the luxury ‘DaVinci' catamaran. This modern 39 ft cruiser provides day trips off Phuket's shores with impeccable service and experienced crew. Experience the thrill of sailing, the fun of tuna fishing along the way, and the joy of splashing into the Andaman's beautifully warm waters. Day trip to Koh Raya or Phuket's southern islands to experience pristine waters perfect for snorkeling or a beachside stroll under swaying coconut palms. DaVinci comfortably accommodates up to 12 guests for day trips with a skipper and 1-2 other crew. The boat is fully equipped including refrigerators and iceboxes and a delectable Thai buffet lunch is provided under the shade.

And what better way to explore than by canoe! Venture north by boat to explore the incredible beauty of Phang Nga National Park. Sightsee the spectacular nature from your canoe and paddle into Mut Cave at Panak Island. A delicious lunch spread is prepared on board before spending the afternoon at your leisure. Naka Bay or Lawa Island are the ideal locations to relax, have a swim or practice your canoeing skills amongst the luscious scenery and tropical waters of the national park. And when your limbs are just beginning to ache, you'll be whisked back home, direct to your hotel.

INSTANTBook now and get your e-ticket instantly INSTANT  Book now and get your e-ticket instantly Spend the day exploring Thailand's bluest waters and whitest sands Visit some of Thailand's best snorkeling islands Go ashore for a beach stroll or a relax on Similan's powder white sands Relish a delicious Thai style buffet lunch Enjoy complimentary hotel pick up and drop off Visit some of Thailand's best snorkeling islands Go ashore for a beach stroll or a relax on Similan's powder white sands Relish a delicious Thai style buffet lunch Enjoy complimentary hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: Just 84 km northwest of the deckchairs and bustling crowds of Patong lies the gateway to another, far less congested, world. Koh Similan is one of the Andaman's most spectacular island groups, largely due to the strikingly clear blue waters that surround it, worthy of being considered one of the 10 most interesting underwater sites in the world. Cruise by speedboat to this island paradise, snorkel amongst tropical fish and colorful coral, enjoy a seafood island lunch and relax on what are widely renowned as Thailand's whitest sands.
